Scott Brown: s claim that Jeanne Shaheen supports a "national energy tax" was repeated on his website, in press releases, and in an op-ed during his campaign.
Judy Reardon: Shaheen's chief counsel, challenged Brown's campaign to provide evidence of Shaheen's support for a "national energy tax" on Twitter.
Brown: s campaign pointed to Shaheen's vote on a 2013 budget resolution put forth by Sen. Sheldon Whitehouse, which outlined a rough framework for how money generated from a carbon tax would be used.
Shaheen: s vote on the budget resolution was not directly in support of a carbon tax, but rather to initiate a discussion on the best way to use proceeds from a potential carbon tax.
